intro: Chaetanthus tenellus, commonly known as the slender chaetanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
